metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7447 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the gdk_cairo_set_source_pixbuf function in gdk/gdkcairo.c in GTK+ before 3.9.8, as used in eom, gnome-photos, eog, gambas3, thunar, pinpoint, and possibly other applications, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a large image file, which triggers a large memory allocation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7447` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

eog - 3.18.1-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

gir1.2-gtk-2.0 - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
gtk2-engines-pixbuf - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
gtk2.0-examples - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
libgail-common - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
libgail18 - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
libgtk2.0-0 - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
libgtk2.0-bin - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
libgtk2.0-common - 2.24.29-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eog package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.18.1-1ubuntu2').
gtk+2.0 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.24.29-1ubuntu2').
pinpoint: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
